name: Mexican Street Corn Salad (Esquites)
description: A Mexican street food favorite featuring charred corn kernels mixed with mayonnaise, feta, lime, and chili powder.

ingredients.item: 3 cups corn kernels or 4 ears of corn
Chili powder or hot chili flakes, to taste

instructions: Mise en Place:
Corn
Measure 3 cups of corn and put in a medium bowl.
Add 2 Tablespoons of vegetable oil to large non-stick pan on cooktop.
Scallion Mixture
Finely slice 1/2 cup of scallion greens and put in a large bowl.
Finely chop 1/2 cup of fresh cilantro leaves and combine with the scallion greens in a large bowl.
Seed and destem 1 jalapeño pepper.
Finely chop the jalapeño and combine with the scallion mixture in a large bowl.
Mince 2 medium garlic cloves to yield 1 to 2 teaspoons of minced garlic.
Combine the garlic with the scallion mixture in the large bowl.
Juice 1 lime and reserve 1 Tablespoon of juice in small ramekin.
Combine the lime juice with the scallion mixture in the large bowl.
Crumble 2 ounces of feta cheese and combine with scallions mixture in the large bowl.
Measure 2 Tablespoons of mayonnaise and combine with the scallions mixture in the large bowl.
Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet or wok over high heat until shimmering.
Add corn kernels
season to taste with salt, toss once or twice
cook without moving until charred on one side, about 2 minutes.
Toss corn, stir, and repeat until charred on second side, about 2 minutes longer.
Continue tossing and charring until well charred all over, about 10 minutes total (2 minutes of char x5). Transfer to a large bowl.
Add corn to scallion mixture and toss to combine.
Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and more chili powder to taste. Serve immediately.
